execution_summary: Built a Python 3.10 Docker environment with pinned numpy/pandas/scipy/statsmodels, started a container, and executed replication_data/replicate_gerhold__py.py against /app/data/data_gerhold.csv. The script implemented the preregistered plan: constructed a binary female indicator, normalized survey weights to mean 1, computed Welch’s t-tests and WLS (HC1) gender differences for mh_anxiety_1 and mh_anxiety_3, and wrote results to /app/data/replication_results.json. The analysis ran successfully with no deviations, aside from pinning exact dependency versions to fix Docker build parsing of version constraints.

code_executed.logs: Initial build failed due to shell parsing error of '<' in pip constraints. Updated replication_info.json to pin exact versions (numpy==1.23.5, pandas==1.5.3, scipy==1.9.3, statsmodels==0.13.5). Regenerated Dockerfile and rebuilt successfully.

code_executed.command: docker run --rm -v ./data:/app/data replication_env_original_4_data_only (framework-managed) then python replication_data/replicate_gerhold__py.py
code_executed.logs: Execution completed with exit_code 0. Printed JSON summary and wrote /app/data/replication_results.json. No stderr.
code_executed.environment: Python 3.10 with numpy 1.23.5, pandas 1.5.3, scipy 1.9.3, statsmodels 0.13.5

results.hypothesis_tested: Women will report higher agreement (higher Likert scores) on COVID-19 anxiety items (mh_anxiety_1 and mh_anxiety_3) than men in the Germany sample.

tables.table_description: Gender differences for mh_anxiety_1 and mh_anxiety_3 using unweighted Welch t-tests and weighted WLS with robust SEs.
